answer_html: The larger \(\alpha\) (the more effective a fisherman is at catching fish) the faster the amount of fish decreases.
answer_latex:
The larger $\alpha$ (the more effective a fisherman is at
catching fish) the faster the amount of fish decreases.
hints_html:
Notice the negative sign, hence the amount of fish decreases when \(\alpha\) increases.

Further, notice that the term with \(\alpha\) is proportional to the product of fishermen, N, and fish, F. What do fishermen do to fish?

The units for \(\alpha\) are

\[\begin{aligned} \frac{1}{\text{fishermen}\cdot\text{days}}.\end{aligned}\]
hints_latex:
Notice the negative sign, hence the amount of fish decreases when
$\alpha$ increases.

Further, notice that the term with $\alpha$ is proportional to the
product of fishermen, N, and fish, F. What do fishermen do to fish?
hints_raw:
Notice the negative sign, hence the amount of fish decreases when <math>\alpha</math> increases.

Further, notice that the term with <math>\alpha</math> is proportional to the product of fishermen, <i>N</i>, and fish, <i>F</i>. What do fishermen do to fish?
The units for <math>\alpha</math> are 
:<math>\frac{1}{\text{fishermen}\cdot\text{days}}</math>.
question: C 02 (b)
sols_html:
The term with \(\alpha\) tends to make the value of F decrease since it has a negative sign in front of it. Because of this, and the fact that this term depends on both the population of fish and the number of fishermen, we conclude that this term models the interaction between fishermen and the fish. The interaction of fisherman and fish leads to less fish because they get caught by the fishermen.

The constant \(\alpha\) represents the rate at which a single fisherman catches fish. The larger \(\alpha\) (the more effective a fisherman is at catching fish) the faster the amount of fish decreases.

has a negative sign in front of it. Because of this, and the fact that
this term depends on both the population of fish and the number of
fishermen, we conclude that this term models the interaction between
fishermen and the fish. The interaction of fisherman and fish leads to
less fish because they get caught by the fishermen.

The constant $\alpha$ represents the rate at which a single fisherman
catches fish. The larger $\alpha$ (the more effective a fisherman is at
catching fish) the faster the amount of fish decreases.
sols_raw:
The term with <math>\alpha</math> tends to make the value of <i>F</i> decrease since it has a negative sign in front of it. Because of this, and the fact that this term depends on both the population of fish and the number of fishermen, we conclude that this term models the interaction between fishermen and the fish. The interaction of fisherman and fish leads to less fish because they get caught by the fishermen.

The constant <math>\alpha</math> represents the rate at which a single fisherman catches fish. The larger <math>\alpha</math> (the more effective a fisherman is at catching fish) the faster the amount of fish decreases.
statement_html:
The population of fish in a particular lake is given by the function F(t) where F is measured in number of fish and t is measured in days. A company that manages fish stocks is hired to restock the lake, adding fish at a constant rate. Only N fishers are allowed to fish in the lake at a time. A simple model for this scenario is given by the equation:

\(\frac{dF}{dt} = I - \alpha N F\)

Where I and \(\alpha\) are constant and two cases for N are considered.

Explain in words what the constant \(\alpha\) represents.
statement_latex:
The population of fish in a particular lake is given by the function
\emph{F(t)} where \emph{F} is measured in number of fish and \emph{t} is
measured in days. A company that manages fish stocks is hired to restock
the lake, adding fish at a constant rate. Only \emph{N} fishers are
allowed to fish in the lake at a time. A simple model for this scenario
is given by the equation:

$\frac{dF}{dt} = I - \alpha N F$

Where \emph{I} and $\alpha$ are constant and two cases for \emph{N} are
considered.

Explain in words what the constant $\alpha$ represents.
statement_raw:
The population of fish in a particular lake is given by the function ''F(t)'' where ''F'' is measured in number of fish and ''t'' is measured in days.  A company that manages fish stocks is hired to restock the lake, adding fish at a constant rate.  Only ''N'' fishers are allowed to fish in the lake at a time.  A simple model for this scenario is given by the equation: 

<math>\frac{dF}{dt} = I - \alpha N F </math>

Where ''I'' and <math>\alpha</math> are constant and two cases for ''N'' are considered.  

Explain in words what the constant <math>\alpha</math> represents.
